channel.title: Cache health
channel.description:
Does anyone know if there is any reason for the non-contingency of the files in the cache? I'm making a cache editor, and was thinking of adding a diagnostic utility with it, and was wondering if making the existing data contingent would "damage" the cache.
The main reason that I could think of for non-contingency is the ability to add more data, or edit existing data, without having to essentially rewrite the entire cache.

item.title: Cache health
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Does anyone know if there is any reason for the non-contingency of the files in the cache? I’m making a cache editor, and was thinking of adding a diagnostic utility with it, and was wondering if making the existing data contingent would “damage” the cache.

The main reason that I could think of for non-contingency is the ability to add more data, or edit existing data, without having to essentially rewrite the entire cache.

Read full topic
